main: ^"Alright, end of the world, there must be someone in a bar"
^"This is strange, it seems to be rather empty in here, I wonder why? "Maybe the bartender will know."
^"Hey, sweetheart, can I get you anything?"
^"Oh no, I don’t drink, but thank you"
^"If you don’t drink, what brings you to my bar?"
^"Well, I'm a journalist and I decided to spend my last few days doing what I love. I'm here looking for someone to interview."
^"So umm… You said this was your bar, right? Why do you keep it open when it's so vacant?"
^"Oh, so I guess I'm your interviewee, interesting choice."
^"Well, I keep the bar open not so much for me but for my people. I worry about them a lot."
^"Okay, have you heard of  the Emerald Mafia, those mischievous trouble makers?"
^"Honestly, I just picked at random, tho seems I've lucked out, but yes, I know about them. Why do you bring it up?"
^"Honestly, I just picked at random, though seems I've lucked out, but yes, I know about them. Why do you bring it up?"
^"Well,l this bar is a known front for that mafia."
^"Wait, you said you own this bar…"
^“Yes. And it's named after me, too. Do you understand where this is going?”
^"So you are the boss, in more than one way…"
^"Exactly, and a bloody good one at that."
^"Okay..Mafia. When I walked in, I didn't think that you would be a criminal."
^"One complicated family you have, I can understand why it worries you."

c-0: ^"You never know someone's story, as a journalist,t you should know better than to just judge someone."
c-1: ^“I wouldn't trade it for the world, though"
^“I never thought someone would talk so sweetly about a mafia gang."
^"I guess there is always some part of a person to love, even for ruffians and thugs."
c-2: ^“I'm enticing? That’s a new one, but given my job, I can't blame you for that."
^“A beautiful woman, as you know her value, why wouldn’t I wanna know more?"
^“Indeed, the complexity of your job already holds so much."
^“Well, my job is my life, for better or worse."
^“Look, you gotta make time for yourself, remember you are more than what you do."
^“I get it, your job makes you happy and it's obviously fulfilling, surrounded by people you care about. I don’t see anything wrong with that."

afterFirstChoice: ^"So, can I ask how you ended up in this situation?”
^“Well, when the Emerald City was still newly developing, my grandfather left Italy to live here, and he basically became a loan shark to make ends meet.”
^“He grew a community like this and so became the Emerald Mafia.”
^“Oh wow, so he really made something for himself”
^“He had 3 sons and taught them the ins and outs of the business. After he passed, his eldest son took over, that being my dad.”
^“Then it was my turn. My dad built me this bar, as a gift for my handover, called it Sienna's place.
^“He built it in our favourite place in the city.”
^"So you guys are basically a family of criminals…"
^"Ahhh, it's generational. So some of your reputation is carried by your name, the legacy of those before you."
^"Ah so a woman in power, that’s impressive, especially in this world run by men."

c-0: ^"I mean technically, but it's deeper than the law is neglectful of many people. So call us criminals for all I care, we exist for a reason."
c-1: ^"I would agree with that sentiment, my father and his father made this life for me."
^“Hey, it's not all of them, you have to carry that legacy, hold up to their standards."
^“I'm surprised at the amount of heart and love that can be found in a mafia gang, it's really a fresh perspective."
c-2: ^“I do pride myself that I'm not the most intimidating but yet my presence demands respect."
^“I mean, come on, to hold authority like this in an environment like you have to be at least a little scary."
^“You should be proud, you are a beautiful woman who has done a lot."
^“You flatter me, but I'll take the compliments."
^“Well, you are an easy person to compliment."

afterSecondChoice: ^"There is a lot of history here, tell me why this is your favourite place in the city.”
^“Growing up, he really valued ‘us’ time, given his work.  So we would come here for picnics, it was my favourite place in the city.”
^“What a rare experience, in a job like that, to still make time for father-daughter time.”
^“I mean, we are still human, we still have hearts”
^“Actually it kinda breaks my heart, but I think I'm going to close the bar”
^“Oh no, why would you do that?”
^“Well, it's just me working now, and I can't manage by myself. The business is suffering for it, so I feel like I have no choice. Plus, what's the point with the end so close?”
^“No, you can't let the legacy die like this. Let me help you. I'm sure we can get it ready for customers again.”
^“Then maybe you can host one last good night for a farewell.”
^"Thanks for coming by sweetheart, its nice to chat with someon every once and a while"
